newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: Czech Karosa says RVI increases stake-CTK.
newsitem.headline: Czech Karosa says RVI increases stake-CTK.

text.p: France's Renault Vehicules Industriels SA (RVI) has increased its stake in the Czech Republic's largest bus maker, Karosa a.s., to a majority holding, the CTK news agency reported on Tuesday.
The agency, quoting Karosa official Milos Huryta, said RVI bought 17 percent of Karosa from the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD), adding this to its previous 34 percent stake.
Officials from the EBRD and RVI were not immediately available for comment.
RVI took its original 34 percent stake in east Bohemian bus maker in 1993.
Karosa sold 1,129 buses in 1996, of which 615 were exported, mostly to countries of the former Soviet Union and Slovakia. The sales represented a six percent increase from the previous year.
Company officials have said last year's sales were the highest since 1992, when they reached 1,176.
